isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: FABCO SDA-12 - OPERATION

svcsubsecinfo.para: Driving forces are put into the axle at the pinion yoke on the differential carrier; they pass through the differential to the inner axle shafts and the inner drive yoke of the universal joint. They then pass into the outer drive yoke and the outer axle shaft, which connects to the wheel hub and wheel.

When steered, the outer section of each steerable drive end turns about the kingpin centerline. The universal joint is centered on the kingpin centerline and allows driving forces to turn with the steered wheel ends.
The axle can be equipped with air or hydraulic brakes. The brake shoes expand to contact conventional brake drums.

svcproc.title: OPERATION INSTRUCTIONS
svcproc.para: The front drive axle can be shifted into operation for improved traction where the rear wheels may lose traction while operating in loose dirt, sand, mud, snow, or ice. Engagement can be accomplished at any vehicle speed as long as the rear axle wheels are not spinning. Engagement is best accomplished with engine pulling lightly.
